buy into something.translation[0].defini: to accept that an idea is right and allow it to influence you
I never bought into this idea that you have to be thin to be attractive.
to buy part of a business or organization, especially because you want to control it
Investors were invited to buy into state-owned enterprises.
buy into something.translation[1].defini: to buy part of a company or business
A lot of US companies are buying into Japanese firms.
In momentum investing, the name of the game is being the first investor to buy into a stock, and the first investor to sell out before bad news breaks.
My last employer expected us to buy into the ideas of every new American business guru, without question.
